sub_title: PhD Candidate at Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
summary:
Welcome on my personal LinkedIn page. I would like to introduce you to myself concerning my job, studies, experience, and interests.

I am currently working as a PhD Candidate at Maastricht University. Before starting my PhD, I have been working as a research assistant and have obtained my Master's in Management of Learning at the School of Business and Economics of Maastricht University. This master combines elements from economics, business, human resource management and learning sciences. I obtained my Bachelor of Business Administration at the Hotel Management School of Maastricht. During this bachelor, I did an operational internship as a receptionist in Paris and a management internship as Human Resources Intern in The Hague. Furthermore, I attended the pre-master programme for Maastricht University.

school.name: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
Zuyd Hogeschool | Zuyd University of Applied Sciences

projects.title: Limburgse Bestuurders Dag 2015
projects.description: During my minor of Event Management at the Hotel Management School of Maastricht I worked on a project to organize the Limburgse Bestuurdersdag 2015. This is an event during which all directors of Limburg come together for the annual meeting of the municipalities of Limburg.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Maastricht University School of Business and Economics

projects.title: Assistant teacher Business communication
projects.description: I was assisting my teacher in Business communication classes for the first year Students of the Hotel Management School Maastricht. I was responsible for giving presentations, lectures and feeback and I checked their final reports as well.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Maastricht University School of Business and Economics

projects.title: Gastronomic event
projects.description: During this project I worked within a group of fifteen students and we were responsible for organizing a gastronomic event. Besides being a participant, I also had the role of secretary. By organizing the event I developed several skills, such as my communication and organisation skills.

profile_positions.company: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
profile_positions.description: My research project aims to improve our understanding of mentoring for graduate employability, and more specifically, the mediating role of student reflection.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.company: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
profile_positions.description: Writing my PhD research proposal, following additional preparatory courses.
profile_positions.title: Pre-PhD candidate

profile_positions.company: Maastricht University School of Business and Economics
profile_positions.description: I have been participating in a project team working on the Bachelor Learning Experience project. Within this project, all bachelor programs of the School of Business and Economics faculty have been researched. The aim of the project was to constructively align the different courses of a particular Bachelor program with each other in terms of educational design, and simultaneously combining it with learning experiences of the Bachelor students.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: Hotel Des Indes, a Luxury Collection Hotel

profile_positions.description:
In the last year of my Bachelor at the Hotel Management School Maastricht I did a management internship as Human Resources Trainee at Hotel Des Indes in The Hague. During this internship, I was responsible for the administrative tasks of the department as well as for the recruitment and selection process. Furthermore, I was involved in the on-boarding process of new employees and gave several trainings and workshops. Processing employee related information in various HR systems was also one of my tasks. Lastly, I gained insights into HR budgets and payroll systems. 

During this internship I worked together with the Human Resources Managers, since the HR department only consisted of one trainee and the HR manager herself. Because of this, I learned a lot about the Human Resources department. Together we were responsible for about 90 employees of the hotel and about 25 outsourced employees of the Housekeeping department. What I really liked about this internship is the fact that I knew every one of the employees and that I could see the results of our recruitment and selection process in the way of how the newly hired employees performed within their new teams. In addition, no day was the same and this was something I really appreciated.
profile_positions.title: Human Resources Intern

company.name: Renaissance Hotels, Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe

profile_positions.description: During my practical internship at Renaissance Paris Arc de Triomphe Hotel, I worked within the Front Office department. I worked as an independent receptionist, with multiple tasks within the Front Office department. The most important tasks were solving problems, doing the outmost for guests and building relationships with the guests. Furthermore, I gained knowledge about all tasks of a receptionist, as well as being a representative of the hotel by being the Guest Experience Ambassador. At last, I also developed my cultural awareness and intercultural communication skills by living and working in a foreign country.
profile_positions.title: Front Office Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: In August 2016, I volunteerd as a group leader during Kindervakantiewerk Bunde. This is a week in which around 100 children between the ages of 4-11 signed up to have a 'holiday'​ week. In this week we undertake all kinds of activities, such as visiting an amusement park, doing a scouting expedition, preparing an open air theater night and building shets to stay the night. This week is all about having fun and making it a memorable experience for all the children. During this week I had the responsibility of group leader together with 3 other adults to supervise a group of 12 children.

I volunteered at the annual fair of Bunde, a small town in the south of The Netherlands close to Maastricht. During this fair, I had multiple taks and responsibilities to make sure that the fair was going well. My main tasks were selling food and beverage tokens to the visitors and doing several shifts behind the bar to make sure everyone could have a nice drink during the event.
